image_widget.alt_text: Time for Umbrellas. The story Time for Umbrellas is told with a series of cards that have words and pictures. Each picture includes the image of a duck that has something to say about the picture.
1. At first, People used umbrellas to protect themselves from the sun, not the rain.
The picture shows a man with an umbrella on a sunny day. There are two pyramids behind him. The duck says, What a cool idea!
2. Then later on, Only important people, like kings and queens, used umbrellas.
The picture shows a man walking with a servant on a sunny day. The servant is holding a very fancy umbrella over the man's head. Behind them is a big building. The duck says, He looks important.
3. As time went by, Only women carried umbrellas to protect themselves from the sun and rain.

The picture shows a rainy day. There are two women, holding umbrellas and talking. A man is walking behind them, without an umbrella. The duck is looking at the women; he says, They have the right idea.
4. Then, about 200 years ago, A man named Jonas Hanway decided to carry an umbrella in public.

The picture shows 3 men on a rainy day one of them is Jonas Hanway. He is holding an umbrella. The other two men are not. One of them is pointing at Jonas Hanway and laughing. The duck says, Look! A man with an umbrella!
The picture shows 3 people on a rainy day. One person has an umbrella. Another man is sharing an umbrella with a young boy. The duck says, Oops! No umbrella.
